title: 7 Ways to Resolve the “Missing File Privileges” Error on Steam

steps.title: A simple restart might fix the error.
steps.content: A simple restart might fix the error. Go to the Start menu, select the Power icon, and click Restart . Once your PC boots up again, open Steam to see if the issue is resolved.

steps.title: Running Steam as an administrator restores missing file privileges.
steps.content: Running Steam as an administrator restores missing file privileges. If the account your using doesn't have permission to write to certain folders, you'll see a "Missing File Privileges" error. To do this, close Steam completely, then right-click the Steam icon and select Run as administrator . If this fixes the error, you can make Steam open as an administrator every time by right-clicking the Steam icon, selecting Properties , and clicking Run this program as an administrator in the Compatibility tab. You also should ensure administrators have permissions for the Steamapps folder. Right-click the Steamapps folder in the Steam directory, go to Properties > Security > Advanced , and ensure administrators have full control.

steps.title: If you have an Intel GPU, restarting this module can resolve errors.
steps.content: If you have an Intel GPU, restarting this module can resolve errors. You will only see this process in Task Manager if you're using an Intel graphics card. First, open Task Manager by pressing Ctrl + Shift Esc on your keyboard. Right-click "igfxEM Module" and select End Task .

steps.title: Clogged or corrupt cache files can cause Steam errors.
steps.content: Clogged or corrupt cache files can cause Steam errors. Once you clear the download cache in Steam, the "Missing File Privileges" error will often go away. In Steam, go to Settings > Downloads > Clear cache . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Corrupted files in a game can prompt "Missing File Privileges" and other errors.
steps.content: Corrupted files in a game can prompt "Missing File Privileges" and other errors. Go to your Steam library, right-click the game you're getting the error in, and select Properties . Go to Installed Files > Verify integrity of game files and allow the file checker to find and repair corrupt or missing files. This process will take a few minutes. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repairing a folder will prompt Steam to download missing files.
steps.content: Repairing a folder will prompt Steam to download missing files. If other solutions haven't fixed the error, this step often will. In Steam, go to Settings > Storage , click the three-dot menu next to your current storage location, and select Repair library .

steps.title: A fresh install will make the error go away.
steps.content: A fresh install will make the error go away. In Steam, you can right-click a game to uninstall it, then you can reinstall it from the library. If you're using Steam VR , this is the only solution available.
